intro: Licania palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palm-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is typically found in lowland and montane rainforests, growing as an understorey shrub. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
